item.title: How to Work with Multiple Github Account with a Single Computer
item.description: Steps to Set-Up Per-directory Github Information StackOverflow Answer to “Multiple github accounts on the same computer?” Pavan’s answer is very helpful; The key is that you can use ~/.ssh/config to set up an alias of github, such as github-my-org (using your new account and new key to connect) and then you will need to replace the git remote string: from git@github.com:username/repo.git to: git@github-my-org:username/repo.git So that a particular repo will use your new key to push to Github.
